connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from COAP capable devices.

camel.sink.path.uri.name: camel.sink.path.uri
camel.sink.path.uri.description: The URI for the CoAP endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.alias.name: camel.sink.endpoint.alias
camel.sink.endpoint.alias.description: Sets the alias used to query the KeyStore for the private key and certificate. This parameter is used when we are enabling TLS with certificates on the service side, and similarly on the client side when TLS is used with certificates and client authentication. If the parameter is not specified then the default behavior is to use the first alias in the keystore that contains a key entry. This configuration parameter does not apply to configuring TLS via a Raw Public Key or a Pre-Shared Key. One of: [NONE] [WANT] [REQUIRE]

camel.sink.endpoint.cipherSuites.name: camel.sink.endpoint.cipherSuites
camel.sink.endpoint.cipherSuites.description: Sets the cipherSuites String. This is a comma separated String of ciphersuites to configure. If it is not specified, then it falls back to getting the ciphersuites from the sslContextParameters object.

camel.sink.endpoint.clientAuthentication.name: camel.sink.endpoint.clientAuthentication
camel.sink.endpoint.clientAuthentication.description: Sets the configuration options for server-side client-authentication requirements. The value must be one of NONE, WANT, REQUIRE. If this value is not specified, then it falls back to checking the sslContextParameters.getServerParameters().getClientAuthentication() value.

camel.sink.endpoint.privateKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.privateKey
camel.sink.endpoint.privateKey.description: Set the configured private key for use with Raw Public Key.

camel.sink.endpoint.pskStore.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pskStore
camel.sink.endpoint.pskStore.description: Set the PskStore to use for pre-shared key.

camel.sink.endpoint.publicKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.publicKey
camel.sink.endpoint.publicKey.description: Set the configured public key for use with Raw Public Key.

camel.sink.endpoint.recommendedCipherSui.name: camel.sink.endpoint.recommendedCipherSuitesOnly
camel.sink.endpoint.recommendedCipherSui.description: The CBC cipher suites are not recommended. If you want to use them, you first need to set the recommendedCipherSuitesOnly option to false.

camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters
camel.sink.endpoint.sslContextParameters.description: Set the SSLContextParameters object for setting up TLS. This is required for coapstcp, and for coaps when we are using certificates for TLS (as opposed to RPK or PKS).

camel.sink.endpoint.trustedRpkStore.name: camel.sink.endpoint.trustedRpkStore
camel.sink.endpoint.trustedRpkStore.description: Set the TrustedRpkStore to use to determine trust in raw public keys.

camel.component.coap.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.coap.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.coap.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.coap.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.coap.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.coap.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
